caption: Horrible food! Would not go again. I’ve never tasted worse Chinese food...We tried the Generals Tso Chicken and it had no flavor. Noodles were soggy. Tofu we just threw out.
We had a good experience the food was very good and the service was great.

I almost hate to give such a bad review to this place. Seems like hard working staff who are trying to get by. But they are disorganized, food took an inordinate amount of time, and then it was cold when it got to us (so it had clearly been sitting around for 30 minutes, despite my asking for it several times). I personally did not love the taste, but it is supposedly a different style and others may like it better. Still, the lack of coordination of the kitchen and wait for food that is then cold, points to lack of leadership and standards by management. Reminds me of Kitchen Nightmares with Gordon Ramsey -- and every episode with these sorts of issues also has storage room full of rotten meat and moldy vegtables.  The restaurant is completely empty, and they blame it on covid. But every other restaurant in Miami is packed. They may want to consider, there is probably a reason beyond covid that they are empty and others aren't.  This restaurant needs management to step up and start leading. My message to them: Watch Kitchen Nightmares and take notes. You have many of the same problems.

We went with the whole family and had an excellent experience! We were greeted from the first moment by Jenny the owner of the place who was very kind who had a lot of patience to explain each dish that we did not know. In addition, the restaurant was super convenient located near the Marriott hotel in Biscayne blvd where we stayed and the open Chinese kitchen made our meeting a real evening, it gave us confidence and security since we could see the dishes as they were cooked for us and everything at the moment. We ordered the Pork Chop from this place it is delicious, a portion of orange duck and sauteed seafood ! Incredible experience, I recommend it a thousand times!
Good fresh quality food.

For the first time in many, many visits I was very disappointed with the food and service of the restaurant. It's very sad to see that a place that was been so good for so many years has deteriorated this way.

The food is good but super expensive how is it that I order 5 things and it comes out to $90 im sorry but that is   the price on the menu don't even add up to $90.  But in all fairness there food is extremely delicious

One of my favorite restaurants in Miami. Love the variety of asian flavors, the decor, service is ok depends on a waiter. Probably over 10 times i gave been and all the time i order the same food. And don't forget the huge fortune cookie desert!
Great sea view, polite, prompt service, large portions, pleasant ambiance, good prices, near ample parking

The restaurant is located inside the Doubletree Hotel.  As soon as your walk in make a right, then a quick left and then all the way down.  This is def a solid 3.  Service was fair.  We ordered wonton soup, it was good.  The lo mean was interesting good, the duck lousy, the orange beef was tasty, the veggies were really delicious.  18% tip included.  We could see ourselves ordering to go again.  The place/ambiance is really boring and there was not view of the bay.

This place was fantastic! Incredibly affordable, incredibly tasty. And super nice people! Definitely stop by!  We had the Siu Mai, which was outstanding and I highly recommend, great Chinese broccoli, a xiao longbao and a tasty pork fried rice!  I gotta go back for more Siu Mai - so good!!

Hello, good afternoon, today I went to this place for the first time and my experience was terrible, when I arrived at the place a man took my temperature sitting at the table, he did not ask me or tell me good afternoon or what he wanted, or He gave me the letter, he only told me to give him his arm to measure my temperature, it was like 2-odd long in the afternoon, there were few people in the place sitting, then all the employees began to talk all together gossiping and none He came to attend me or ask what I wanted? Please improve your customer service, terrible customer service, I had to get up from my seat and go and say goodbye because they did not attend me, I will not return to this place again nor do I recommend anyone to go, terrible place, before coming here go to another better place and you will not have any bad experience like me
Awesome classic cuisine. A staple in Miami. A definite good pick!
chinese food, yummy. Filled me up. It has a cool atmosphere.

Service was bad. Like really bad. 3 servers, 4 tables and everything took forever. I totally understand having a lot of To Go orders, but that's no excuse for the server to be M.I.A. for for tge entirety of our visit. They also attach gratuity automatically (table of 2). I would suggest ordering To Go as you will be prioritized.
Best authentic Chinese food in Miami.

Omg! The food was delicious as always when I visit Tony Chan's Water Club in downtown miami. I can't get tired of their fresh and tasty options. I often visit Tony for lunch and order either eggplant and rice with vegetables. This time I went there with my husband and he ordered beef, he loved it. Also, I ordered sushi to go and sesame chicken. I really recommend to anyone that will like to experience Hong Kong style cuisine from New York city here in miami. They are located inside the doubletree grand hotel by the water. Fantastic staff and the owners are very friendly.
Food not very fresh especially seafood
I like very much the food, fast service, good price, authentic Chinese service.. Absolutely wonderful!
Great food

Tony Chan’s gotta be one of the best Chinese Restaurant I have eaten at in South Florida in the past 5 years, it’s clean, quiet and staff is very kind and polite. The owner Jenny greeted us and she was very friendly and helpful. No buffet style, it’s a la carte. People act like they’ve never seen food before. The quality of the food is 5 stars, every dish we had was delicious  and most importantly fresh. I would definitely recommend this gem to everyone visiting Miami or locals.
I was so hungry and excited to try this place.  But its is absolutely the worst Chinese I've had to date in my opinion.  Portions are ok but the food lacked flavor.
Love the chicken corn soup and rice noodles! Great service and love the location.

Excellent! I love this place ! I have been here multiple times. The food was so good and authentic. They have an authentic Chinese menu and everything I've ordered is excellent. Highly recommend the Peking duck We will definitely be back!

Though this place is slightly expensive for Chinese food, but their food is actually good. Their signature is their duck, eel rice, and French style beef with onions. Those are the must ordered dishes! One dish I think is super underrated is their oyster mushrooms! They are super juicy delicious.

Last night we had the best time at dinner - that I think I have EVER had.! From the waiter to servers, to even the WAIT! It was a packed night. Nevertheless, it was a fantastic night. The food was fantastic! The Peking duck and Sushi -just Great! BEST RESTAURANT IN TOWN!  I would give it ten stars, but five stars are all I'm allowed.

They automatically charge an 18% gratuity fee which basically means that the waiter does not even need to try because they are already taking a large tip automatically, The bill ended up being over $70 for a party of 2, For Chinese food... Grossly overpriced.
chinese food and the feeling at this spot is excellent. I can say this place does it for me. Prices were appropriate. Menu is like a cafe in Boston I liked.
One of my favorite places for chinese food. Food with real quality ingredients.  The staff was very helpful and observant.
Ok location for tasty chinese food. food was so delicious. there was quick, helpful, and friendly service. the place has a good feel to it. mood here reminds me of san diego's scene.
Delicious Food & Friendly Staff !!!
Chinese food, excellent. i often meet people here to talk. service treated us so kindly. i can see why they have a lot of great reviews.
chinese food, super tasty. service is consistently great. the bill was appropriate for the quality.

Great place for quality chinese food. Nice place to meet and catch up with family. I've had nothing but enjoyable experiences here and plan to keep visiting. Prices are fair I would say. Menu is like a place in San Francisco I loved.
Place was very clean great food great service it was beautiful outside sitting on the water prices were reasonable big portions on my saying I would recommend it to anybody I know

I'm normally not an udon person, but this place was amazing! I got the #7 (zhajiang udon) and my sister got the #5 (creamy kabocha w/chicken udon). Zhajiangmian is one of my favorite dishes and this zhajiang udon did not disappoint! The noodles were super chewy and the sauce was really good, albeit a bit salty, but the pickled radish was a nice touch that balanced it out. I tried my the broth of #5 and it tasted a lot like clam chowder which I actually enjoyed.

Great place to grab a quick lunch. They offer hand rolls and cut rolls . Go hand roll all way! They offer sets which is better deal than ordering a la carte . Fish was fresh and they used high quality seaweed . As you finish an individual hand roll, chef will make new one. They don't make your whole order at once. This keeps the seaweed crispy which makes all the difference ! I ordered the set with bay scallop, salmon, crab. Also, toro hand roll. The only hand roll that I disliked was the scallop hand roll because they mixed it with mayo. I felt the mayo overpowered the scallop. I would definitely recommend this place to my friends !
This spot never disappoints. They have awesome dishes for fair rates, there is no waiting time even when the place is packed.
Good service,  good food, and nice setup.

two days ago was our first time we came to that restaurant. But It is definitely not the last time. We had a good time with the efficient service, with the great  dishes and wine and with the decent cost. We will absolutely go back there again.

The food is VERY fresh, healthy and mostly Cantonese flavors but also other spectacular Chinese cuisines represented.  The service is EXCELLENT and the prices are really great.  They also have full bar and Sushi.  The sushi must be good although I didn’t try it, but most people ordered sushi too.
The customer service is consistently speedy, great mood, very friendly employees. I will return again when I arrive in town.
Great service. Beautiful place inside a shinny nice hotel.

We visited this restaurant around 4pm for late lunch (because of the jet lag) and were served quickly and generously. We took a delicious miso soup and some california rolls and some absolutely delicious soft sauteed noodles with vegetables. The only downside I found was the environment and the fact that it was really dark inside which gave a gloomy atmosphere to the room. The food was very good though!
Excellent food and service, it was great fun to watch the kitchen. Elegant and tasty at reasonable prices.

Disappointing. I get better sushi in my landlocked state. Miso soup was bland like they cut it with too much water, fish wasn't fresh, the 17$ special roll we got just tasted like onion. Mushy rice. Look elsewhere.
Authentic Chinese seafood! Seafoods are very fresh, and delicious! Very clean
Hot and sour had way too much oyster sauce..coconut curry chicken listed as spicy, was actually bland and relatively tasteless.  Husband liked the wonton soup
Known this place for a few years and the food is always great. Friendly staff and good service. Would definitely recommend this place for great Chinese food.
good chinese food. my visit on business trip.  located inside hotel
Automatic 18% gratuity charged for a party of 2. I expect that for a group of 6-8+ people. They probably would have received a bigger tip had they not been so presumptuous.
The food is good

The food here is 👌🏾👌🏾👍🏽👍🏽 a bit pricey but worth it. The General Tso chicken was amazing and the fried rice is pretty good. Their Valcano beef was ok and they're pork buns are also quite good. Definitely recommend
The service is always fast, fantastic ambience, friendly staff members. I will eat here again when I get here.
Kani su salad, dancing tuna roll, and sake was delicious! Service was good too.
This is the worst Chinese restaurant I ever had,  very expensive and no taste, do not go if you don't want to be disappointed really

I have never written a negative review about a restaurant EVER however this was, without a doubt, the worst dining experience I have ever had. Bad food is one thing, bad food with bad service?  I don’t know if I can even say it was bad cause we really didn’t get any service. Yet they automatically charge 18% gratuity, non debatable.  Scam

Pretty good ramen.  Great broth.  Great service and nice atmosphere and simple decor.  Ordered the customer favorite Tokyo Tonkasu.  For $16 I wish the soup had more content like more meat, vegetables, etc and less noodles..

My top spot for quality chinese food. Visited about four, it was not full. Looking forward to coming back with my coworkers. The bill was fair for the quality of food. They have so many good reviews for a reason.
Outstanding location for tasty chinese food. Visited on Fri I believe. Bring your hunger - portions are large. Menu is like a place in San Francisco I liked.
Excellent restaurant. Love the sushi, always fresh! The best peking duck in town.
This was the best Chinese we've eaten for a very long time. Food is awesome and so is the service. Recommend the deep fried ice cream. So good.
My top place for tasty chinese food. I had a cousin come into town and asked me to take him back here. Bring your appetite because portions are generous.
They serve shark fin soup
Delicious food ,fast service, I enjoyed my meal certainly , nice restaurant indeed , F&B Director Ganesh Khalipe, Thank you ,
Outstanding place for quality chinese food. The staff was very welcoming and observant. Prices were decent. Food is like a restaurant in Jacksonville I liked.
Tried this place for the first time I gotta say it was really good the service was awesome, me and my daughter had no complaints I'd recommend this place...
I like very much the food, fast service, good price, authentic Chinese service. I do not recommend for kids, except if they like Chinese food, there aren’t kids menu. Gluten free available.
In LOVE with their strawberry chicken, Miso ramen and cream cheese ragu (I think that's how you spell it) they have the best customer service too!!!
The shrimp were disgusting at best. No one speaks English. Will never go back.

Stopped in here while staying at Marriott Biscayne Bay. We were hungry after traveling through the afternoon/evening. If I could have a do-over, I’d take it. Food was without flavor and  just not worth eating. On top of that, they tried to slip an 18% gratuity on our bill for a party of 4. Look elsewhere

(Translated by Google) Steamed bamboo shoots are really delicious! If you don't lose the domestic Cantonese restaurant, the price is relatively acceptable. The fried chicken is also very good, the skin is crisp and tender. Shrimp dumplings are generally not recommended. Overall it is highly recommended!  (Original) 清蒸笋壳鱼真是太好吃了！不输国内粤菜馆，价钱也相对能接受。炸子鸡也很不错，皮脆肉嫩。虾饺一般般，不太推荐。总的来说非常推荐！
Lovely staff and great sushi!

Tony Chan’s is located within a little shopping mall between two hotels.  Because of this, I was a little unsure.  With 5 adults and 2 kids, we knew we had a big table with varying tastes.  The soup was fantastic.  The dumplings were amazing - we ate three orders and one of the kiddos ate one all by herself.  The shrimp and vegetable spring rolls were divine.  We had multiple entrees and ate every bite.  And, we had two sushi rolls that even the kids enjoyed.  Even more importantly, the service made the experience.  Our waitress interacted with all of us, including our youngest child, and the food was brought to our table quickly and hot!  Do not hesitate, go and enjoy!  Highly recommended, from all 5 adults and the 2 kiddos.
I love Tony Chan’s! Great service, food and I love they don’t use msg. I wonder if they do dim sum? If you like Chinese food this is a must in Miami.
Nice view and good food!

This is probably the best Chinese in Miami. I am confused by the low ratings. I lived in New York and Toronto, and I think I know pretty good Chinese food when I taste it.  I think stand out dishes include the sweet and sour pork, the beef and ginger clay pot and the sizzling black bean chicken.
Good food and service.

I really dig how you get to watch the cooks prepare the food. Unfortunalty, a star was lost for service. Once we fot service it was fine but we waited at the host stand for quite a while without anyone greeting us. There were employees sitting at a table polishing and folding who didn't seem to care.
Good place, friendly people

(Translated by Google) Central place, very kind staff, fast in service and efficient. Well presented dishes although it is not the best Chinese restaurant I have tried but I must say that I am a vegetarian, maybe traditional dishes will be excellent. Well furnished restaurant on the pier. It's worth stopping to eat here if you feel like Asian. The most beautiful thing is the open kitchen, not really clean but acceptable and well organized. I don't give five stars because even though the food was good it didn't impress me too much and the prices are medium-high, and the cooks without a hat or the dripping of fat in the hoods forbid it. But I recommend it!  (Original) Posto centrale, personale gentilissimo, veloce nel servizio ed efficiente.  Piatti ben presentati anche se non è il migliore ristorante cinese che ho provato ma devo dire che sono vegetariano, magari i piatti tradizionali saranno ottimi. Ristorante arredato bene e sul molo. Vale la pena fermarsi a mangiare qui se si ha voglia di asiatico. La cosa più bella è la cucina a vista, non proprio pulitissima ma accettabile e ben organizzata. Non do cinque stelle perché anche se il cibo era buono non mi ha entusiasmato troppo e i prezzi sono medio alti, e i cuochi senza cappello o le colature di grasso nelle cappe me lo vietano. Ma lo consiglio!

What a great restaurant! Incredibly friendly and attentive service from start to finish matched by well priced and exceptionally good quality food. Our waiter made our night. Well done and thank you for a fantastic evening. We will be back again soon!
(Translated by Google) Too bad the area is destroyed is still good but it is no longer the same  (Original) Q lástima q la zona está destruida sigue siendo bueno pero ya no es el mismo q pena
The best Chinese in Miami, hands down.
Good
Good
(Translated by Google) Perfect!!!!  (Original) Parfait!!!!

Checked into the hotel after a crazy morning that included 2 flights. Room wasn't ready yet and we were pretty hungry. Went down to Tony Chan's for a quick lunch. It was delishous! Lunch specials were reasonably priced. With tip paid $51 for the 3 of us to eat.

BEWARE OF TONY CHAN’S MENU SCAM!!!  I came in for lunch (Thursday at noon), but they gave me an extremely over-priced dinner menu. They do not offer the lunch menu unless you specifically ask for it! So shady!  And when you do ask for the lunch menu, they act like they weren’t thinking and gave you the wrong one. Every customer around me had the same experience (I asked, they all felt scammed). I can’t believe this is how they do business. Trying to trick tourists and locals like that. They should be ashamed of themselves.  As for the food, it was terrible. Meat was chewy, soup was bland, rice was mushy. The chicken was especially odd. It must’ve been old. I don’t think there’s any passion in that kitchen. I think they’ve all given up. I guess they only care about ripping off hotel guests.  And for the service, it was awful. The server was so rude, she obviously didn’t want to be there. She rolled her eyes when I asked for the menu, rolled her eyes when I ordered, and rolled her eyes when I asked for anything during my lunch. Maybe she should change careers.  All in all, I feel disrespected. I have never experienced such shadiness at a restaurant. Unethical and unprofessional. This was my first and last time at Tony Chan’s Water Club.  AVOID THIS SCAM RESTAURANT AT ALL COSTS!!!
Okay food large place
Great food
(Translated by Google) we eat very very rich but server not very pleasant and often desert  (Original) on  mange  bien  tres  copieux  mais  serveur  pas  tres  agreables  et  souvent  desert
Really enjoyed the food there!

Our whole team went to Tony Chan's Water Club inside the Doubletree Grand Hotel lobby, next to the beautiful Biscayne Bay. We loved their cooking which is MSG free; every dish is cooked to order. Rewarded Hong Kong style Cantonese cuisine which it is the lightest among all major 8 regional cuisines in China. That means light in flavor, and also means light in salt and oil in take. Plus, we tried high quality fishes!!! 5 Star Review for a 5 Stars Restaurant
The best in the world starting going there 26 years ago
Very good food and attentive service. Would return.
Great food and excellent service. Good prices.

I had dinner last evening, 23 May 18 at the restarurant and was disappointed.  My food was luke warm at best, the steamed pork dumplings were just ok.  The wrappers weren't made from  a homemade receipt from scratch.  My garlic pork was just okay.  Maybe it was a bad night.  I will try it again choosing other items on the menu.
So good!

We ordered lunch special today from Tony and as always.....magnifico! I used to go into Tony once a week for lunch, but now work restraints hinder that for me. I try to order delivery when I can and I quickly suggested Tonys sushi when coworkers were discussing a group order. Glad that the timing was perfect and the peking duck was outstanding as my suggestion was on the hook. Thank you Tony and Jenny and continuing to produce quality Hong Kong Style food. Hopefully I can make it back in there soon!! :)
Amazing art show with the artist Richard Barrenechea  and the presence of Alfredo Le'rida...organization was perfect!
Roast duck is a must

I ordered the General Tso chicken and the chicken was so tough and full of grissle I had to spit it out. I spoke to two of wait staff and showed them I couldn't even cut through it with a knife and they said nothing!  Steer clear of this place. Not fresh or good food. Wish I could give no stars.

Me and my boyfriend went today for dinner, we loved the miso soup. It was a generous portion. We also tried the fried rice and Tsao chicken which was great too. The crab was a little bit salty but it was an interesting dish.

Wow!! I went last night for dinner, amazing cuisine 5 stars ❤️ They cook with no msg which it’s really important for a great health. Food is super fresh, ambience it’s great. I would recommend this restaurant to all my friends and family. If you are visiting miami and staying in the Downtown area, it’s a whole experience from the moment you get in. I went to New York a couple times to Chinatown and they restaurants have nothing to do with Tony’s quality and service. A must-go! Must try dishes: Their Peking Duck with soup Fresh sushi Fish 🐟 choose any from what they have on the display Can’t wait to go back! Thank you 🙏
Tony Chan's Water Club is an upscale Chinese restaurant that also has Japanese Food. The food and service are very good!!
Congratulations Tony! most delicious sushi ive tried at the bar. 5 stars for this restaurant. The service is always great, relaxed ambience and tasty dishes. Couldn't ask for more. Thanks :)

I loved my visit to Tony Chan’s Water Club! It was really amazing actually seeing how they make my food because they’ve got a huge open and clean kitchen. I was amazed. My boyfriend and I loved their exotic but yet delicious dishes. It felt like traveling to Hong Kong but in the heart of Downtown Miami. We have become fanatics and can’t wait to go back Thank you Tony and keep on doing like that!! now I’ve realized almost 30 years in the restaurant industry actually makes a difference ;)

We love going to Tony Chan's Water Club inside the Doubletree Hotel with my husband and all the family. They have a clean and open kitchen which its amazing!! As a good chef, I love knowing that the food I eat in a restaurant is fresh and I can certify that in Tony Chan's Water Club. We are frequent clients because we enjoy the ambience, its perfect for a family reunion and we can actually have beautiful conversations in their big and comfortable round tables. Speaking about the food, they have a fresh sushi bar at the front where we always have the veggie and salmon roll. As main we enjoy their peking duck, haven't tried something so delicious anywhere else. During the week, we went a couple times with my husband to try their lunch special which was perfect for a break from our work routine. They deserve 5 stars!! Excellent service and extraordinary food quality, thank you!! Lila and Alex
COULDN'T ASK FOR BETTER!!!!

We three dined on Tuesday. Very good food, good service. Like lemon chicken, cashew chicken and "exotic" spicy shrimps - rich in portions. Negative - the same menu for lunch and dinner - lunch is a little more expensive. I hope to see you again.  How could they get rid of Luo Ming?
My wife and I love this place and visit often when in Miami.  A cut above other Chinese restaurants!  The service is quick and food is fresh and delicious.  We are picky diners and highly recommend.

A shadow of it's former self - Me and my family have been coming to TC's for the better part of 10 years. Used to be some of the best Chinese food in Miami - over the course of the last 4 years the food has consistently gotten worse. Heavily starched, gooey, thick grease laden sauces abound & drown out most of the wok seared preparations - Peking Duck we order this last Sunday was a significant SHAM, where after the initial crispy skin course, the whole meat & carcass, where taken back to the kitchen for preparation of the second and third (soup) course, and to our shock, the whole Duck had been BOILED to make a very poor rendition of the broth, and the boiled meat (BOILED !!!) meat of the Duck was served with TOFU (TOFU !!) as a main course. SHAME ON YOU TONY CHAN !!!!!!!!!!! WE ARE NEVER GOING BACK AGAIN IN OUR LIVES !!!

I called to place an order for delivery and the lady seem really nice but since they didn't a bigger size order of fried rice I decided not to order and suddenly I realized this lady was just being nice with me because I was ordering when she hung up on me no saying a word. CUSTOMER SERVICE IS IMPORTANT PEOPLE. I WON'T EVER CALL BACK!!

Food was atrocious. I ordered General Tso chicken and it tasted rubbery and unflavorful. My girlfriend ordered the Harmonious Family and the food reeked like rotten week old seafood. We hazarded a taste and the food was like chewing gum after it was chewed for several days. Severely unimpressed. The service was ok at best

Food was absolutely wonderful, however the service was some of the worst we had ever experienced. Our server took our order, very unfriendly, and then never came back to our table again with exception to when we finally waved her over for our check. Someone from the kitchen delivered our food, a water girl filled my husband's water glass once and a bus boy removed half of our dishes. Our bottle of wine was placed on a bucket on a chair at our table. Strange and put out of convenient reach when you consider we had to pour for ourselves all evening. Imagine our surprise when our check for two included a 20% gratuity. Then we had to flag down a manager to have it removed in order to add our own gratuity based upon our poor service.
Do NOT eat here!!!  Horrible food and horrible service!!!
Place is far from upscale and got serve a lobster Cantonese for $70.00! A real rip off

I loathed my meal so much, I have reset all my passwords for accounts I have forgotten, to review this awfully. Service was great, food was a disgrace. Me and my mother spent most of the day across the street at the passport agency, reviews seemed good so we pick this out instead of the other small places in the Double tree Hilton. The seats we basically outdoor patio chairs but everything else looked upscale including the view of the docks and boats. We sat right next to the huge glass wall looking into the kitchen, after we placed an order we saw one staff member grab an open bowl of dried ramen type noodles and threw them on a table. Then we see another staff come out and throw the noodles and grabs a container of raw chicken off the table, no lid, and throw that into the wok. The kitchen looked really clean but all the open containers of food was discerning. When we received our food, I honestly didn’t know how to feel. I’ve never been disappointed to look at a bowl of pasta before. We had ordered the chicken lo mein, it was pale noodles that literally looked like instant ramen, pale chicken, a few small whole mushroom and a couple green slivers of bell pepper on top. We were so hungry and still on a time crunch to get back to the passport we dug in anyways, more disappointment. It tasted as bland as it looked. As I go to use the soy sauce container to drown my bland noodles, I see a thick lougey type brown thing on the bottle. The bottle wasn’t clear like normal soy sauce so I couldn’t see in the container, so I dumped the bottle on an empty plate and it was lumpy. On top of all this our meal cost us 42 dollars. If you think this visit couldn’t have gotten worse, we asked for sweet tea, our server brought us two glasses of brisk in a cup. Brisk is alright but if you don’t know your getting it, it’s an assault on your taste buds when your mouth really wanted that sweet southern golden nectar. That should be a crime. Just don’t go here. Choose another restaurant so you don’t have to waste your time and you can live without the disappointment that we now will forever have.
My favorite are udon noodles with beef.
Great food, great service. Ordered a whole Peking duck 5 minutes before closing and they took care of me with a smile on their face. Get the general tso chicken.
Fantastic gourmet Chinese food.
Tasteless food & service. The restaurant staff seems to be completely checked out. Tip is compulsory regardless of the quality of service offered. Highly unrecommended!!
Minus stars with long list of negatives : 1) Hopeless food, total waste of money 2) Poor service 3) Rude staff, seems they are being forced to serve customers. Please avoid it.
Red snapper❤️
Had a wonderful time! I was there last year for Xmas and just realized that the rating was not sent. Recommend the duck and pineapple fried rice!!! The best!!!

Stayed at Hilton double tree for business and ate here both nights. I didn't really feel like getting a cab to go eat. I had sushi both nights and the food was great. The first night I didn't get in until after 9 pm and the staff was more than accommodating and very friendly. If your in the area I would highly recommend.

The food wasn't terrible, but the cashier and waitress messed up multiple times while trying to calculate the bill. First, they overcharged us by around $25 because they used the wrong denominator in their calculations. We had to go over it with them to get to the correct value. A few days later, when we were going over our bills, we realized they also deducted 40% as tip instead of the typical 20 to 25%.  When I go to a restaurant, I expect cashiers and waitresses to be competent and honest while carrying out simple calculations, and don't want to worry about overpaying by a large amount. I will not be dining here again.
Real Chinese food by real Chinese. I consider I am a good cook and better than 50% of fake Chinese restaurants. But everything here is better than mine.
I was disappointed because when it said water club I thought it was a strip club for water I tried the food the rice tasted like the salad from McDonalds
Welcome to booger land! The best place for expensive "Chinese food" and great tasting boogers. The owner reviewed his owned restraunt. My pet fish could make better food!
Food tastes like watermelon at kfc

Surprisingly tasty and we'll presented Chinese food.  Staff efficient and if you wish, you may watch your order being prepared through a massive glass wall. This venue needs a bit of updating to create a bit of ambiance.  It is clean and linen is used. Waterfront/marina location and attached to a mall with other dining selections.
Perfect
HORRIBLEEEE.!!!  never coming back again. Service sucks overpriced. Didn't let me use my Groupon. Manager very rude. By the way the place was empty no wonder why.
Force charge 18%tip
Nice restaurant with traditional Cantonese style cuisine
Ordered takeout. Even for bad chinese food takeout, this was pretty terrible. The lo mein was flavorless and the sesame chicken was so soft to the point where I questioned if it was even chicken.
Ok
It may be pricey, but it's worth every penny. Hands down the best Chinese food I've ever had.
Solid Chinese spot in Miami. Definitely try the dim sum menu
I was brought the wrong food, which itself tasted bland. I ordered a small soup and was charged $8.95. I called to have them change it and the person on the phone was very rude and unapologetic.

Great service, very flavorful food and classy ambiance. Decor is classic 80s 90s power dinner and perfect for a date. Kitchen staff is sensitive to food allergies, and will adjust preparation to accomodate. Very attentive!
I am a princess here ...the service is great and they know me well my tSyes my likes ..eat too many years of going there for lunch perhaps 3 times a week ...
Pretty typical sushi restaurant, but it did have a really clean good taste to it, definitely happy with all my menu choices on this visit.  Nothing sets it apart from other places though.

The food was outstanding!!!  The service from our waitress was horrid!  The women never once came over to ask how we were doing or refill on drinks we had to keep flagging down others to help us.  No matter what they add 18% gratuity even for 2 people. I questioned it saying by she did nothing and should not get a tip. The older gentleman understand and was very apologetic and gave us a free round of drinks which we appreciate.  I do not think it is fair that this waitress gets the tip when she never once came to our table and forgot to order our appetizer!  Food was awesome!
QUITE POSSIBLY THE BEST CHINESE FOOD EVER. IM NOT ABLE TO EXPRESS MY LOVE FOR THIS RESTAURANT MORE LOUDLY!!!!!
Excellent place for Chinese food and sushi.

Don't know where to begin..the food was exceptional.  Everything was extremely tasty and the wait time was minimal. Normally I would.worry if the food came.too fast then I was not fresh..not here..it was all fresh and great...well.done to the staff!!!
Nice atmosphere and good food.  Will likely visit again.

I am a Singaporean who has traveled throughout the world and currently reside in DC. Being a fan of Cantonese cuisine, I am upset with the low ratings of this restaurant. If you come to this restaurant ordering General Tso's chicken and then complain about the price, I think this is stupidity at its best. You should ONLY order such a boring dish at a takeout, NOT at this place.  Here is a good Cantonese restaurant that I have eaten, a better one on the East Coast. We ordered hot plate beef, eight treasures duck, eight treasures tofu, all with the authentic Cantonese wok flavor that we craved. Heard the chef is from Hong Kong and has over 20+ years of experience  Good food, highly recommended. Avoid the boring American Chinese dishes, and you won't be disappointed
Love the atmosphere here. My girlfriends and I like coming here for drinks. Always a good time!
It is a bit pricey, but the food and service is really good. Not sure if they justifies the prices, but I will continue to come here because I always enjoy it.
Delicious take out, best in area.  If dining in, get Peking Duck appetizer with soup.  Amazing!
Excellent choice.
The Sushi was great! My husband loved the Spicy Tuna and I really liked the General Tso Chicken ! it was excellent!
Service was great, food was exceptional, experience is just worth the price.

Extremely over priced! I know it's basically located at the Marriott and double tree, so it'll be a bit over priced but this is ridiculous. Okay so maybe the portions are big and the quality is a few notches up... Nope.  $15 bucks for your typical fast food Chinese platter that would cost you $5 anywhere else. There is another Chinese place around that delivers but they have the same ridiculous pricing scheme.  All in all, if you're staying at the Marriott and reading this I'd forget about ordering Chinese.

We had the pleasure of sitting next to the kitchen so we could see the 'cook' unwrap the 'store bought' spring rolls... Mediocre food, 18% gratuity automatically included and the bill was presented to us twice, once before we paid and once after. We'll not be eating there again anytime soon

We went there before the theater, and while the food was alright and the place looked OK; but really fell short of our expectations. The food was good; but not neither gourmet nor authentic, and the view of the bay was a bit obscured by landscaping and a walkway in some disrepair.Altogether, the meal was pretty costly I kind of wish I'd gone someplace else. The service, was excellent, however.
